recipes.name: Bruschetta
instructions: Toast the baguette slices until crispy.
Rub each slice with the garlic clove.
Dice the tomatoes and place them in a bowl.
Add olive oil, salt, and pepper to the tomatoes and mix well.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto each baguette slice.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve.

recipes.name: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Remove stems from mushrooms and finely chop.
Mix the cream cheese, garlic, chopped stems, Parmesan, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Fill each mushroom cap with the mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.

recipes.name: Caprese Salad Skewers
instructions: Thread a cherry tomato, a basil leaf, and a mozzarella ball onto each skewer.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted water according to the package instructions.
While the pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan and cook the pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix in the grated Parmesan cheese.
Once the pasta is ready, drain and immediately add it to the pan with pancetta.
Remove from heat, quickly pour in the egg mixture, and toss well.
Season with black pepper and serve with extra Parmesan.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned and fully cooked.
Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Pour in the soy sauce and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for another 2 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Salsa and sour cream for topping
instructions: Cook the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned.
Add the taco seasoning and stir well.
Warm the taco shells in the oven or microwave.
Fill each shell with beef, lettuce, cheese, and toppings of choice.

recipes.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
ingredients: Butter and cocoa powder for ramekins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F). Butter and dust the ramekins with cocoa powder.
Melt the chocolate and butter together in a bowl over simmering water.
In another bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Gently fold the melted chocolate mixture into the eggs, then add flour and mix until smooth.
Pour the batter into the ramekins and bake for 8-10 minutes until the edges are set and the center is still soft.
Serve immediately with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
instructions: Whip the heavy cream and sugar together until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold in the mascarpone cheese.
Dip each ladyfinger biscuit in the espresso, then layer in a dish.
Spread a layer of the cream mixture on top, then add another layer of soaked biscuits.
Repeat until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cream.
Dust with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

recipes.name: Apple Crumble
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Arrange the apple slices in a baking dish and sprinkle with cinnamon.
In a bowl, mix the flour, oats, and brown sugar. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumble mixture over the apples.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until the top is golden brown and the apples are soft.

recipes.name: Guacamole
instructions: Cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
Add the onion, garlic, tomato, and lime juice to the bowl.
Season with salt and pepper and mix well.
Garnish with cilantro if desired and serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Hummus
instructions: In a blender, combine chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil.
Blend until smooth, adding a little water if needed.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve in a bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with paprika.

recipes.name: Energy Balls
instructions: In a bowl, mix all ingredients until well combined.
Roll the mixture into small balls.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up before serving.
